result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

failed to appear for preliminary hearing Br. 1

2:17 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew D Kripps not in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Andrew D Kripps. Matter set for Prelim, Atty Sarbacker has no information on defendant's presence, State requesting warrant, Court authorizes warrant
Notice of Preliminary Hearing on 7/20/2022 mailed to Defendant at 135 E Emmett St, Portage WI 53901 returned as "Not Deliverable as Addressed, Return to Sender"
Preliminary hearing on July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:02 AM Prosecuting attorney Margaret Anne Sorrentino in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew D Kripps not in court.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Andrew D Kripps. Defendant is in treatment program, not available for today, Atty Sarbacker states defendant will be completed in July, requesting prelim,
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew D Kripps appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven James Sarbacker in court for Andrew D Kripps. State did not object to the modification request. Court approved the request. Bond is modified to a $2000.00 signature bond. All prior conditions remain. 1:50 PM
Bail/bond hearing on May 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:32 PM Prosecuting attorney Jonathan Ross in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andrew D Kripps in court by video in custody from the Columbia County Jail w/Atty Melville Peter Middleton. waives reading of complaint, right to atty recited, $300.00 cash bond, standard felony conditions, not possess/consume controlled substances w/out valid prescription, not possess drug paraphernalia, no possession of weapons, waives time limits to prelim,
